relations.detail: Deep Neural Solver (DNS) uses the Math23K dataset for training and evaluation.
relations.evidence: The dataset contains Chinese math word problems for elementary school students and is crawled from multiple online education websites.
relations.problem_addressed: Evaluating the performance on a large-scale Chinese math word problem dataset

relations.detail: Expression Tree algorithm uses AI2, IL, and CC datasets for evaluation.
relations.evidence: The accuracy of arithmetic word problems is evaluated on the datasets that are manually harvested and annotated from online websites.
relations.problem_addressed: Evaluating the performance on arithmetic word problems

relations.detail: FG-Expression algorithm uses the Dolphin18K dataset for evaluation.
relations.evidence: The dataset is collected and rectified mainly from the math category of Yahoo! Answers.
relations.problem_addressed: Evaluating the performance on a large-scale and diversified dataset

relations.detail: MathDQN optimizes the Expression Tree algorithm by using deep reinforcement learning to select operators.
relations.evidence: MathDQN iteratively picks the best operator for two selected quantities, which can be viewed as beam search with k=1 when exploiting candidate expression trees.
relations.problem_addressed: Improving the efficiency and accuracy of operator selection in arithmetic word problems

relations.detail: FG-Expression extends ALGES by parsing equation templates into fine-grained units.
relations.evidence: FG-Expression parses an equation template into fine-grained units, called template fragments.
relations.problem_addressed: Addressing the brittleness of template-based methods

relations.detail: Deep Neural Solver (DNS) replaces the Expression Tree algorithm by using a seq2seq model with GRU and word embeddings.
relations.evidence: Deep Neural Solver (DNS) is the first deep learning based algorithm that does not rely on hand-crafted features.
relations.problem_addressed: Reducing the reliance on hand-crafted features and improving performance on large datasets

relations.detail: MathDQN improves ALGES by using deep reinforcement learning to model the tree construction process.
relations.evidence: Results show that the model trained by RL is more accurate than using maximum likelihood estimation (MLE) as the objective function.
relations.problem_addressed: Enhancing the accuracy and robustness of solving multi-step arithmetic word problems
